intro: Enceliopsis nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers. The plant has a slender, leafless stem that rises from a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically arranged in a single head, with ray florets that give it a sunflower-like appearance. Enceliopsis nudicaulis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
